titleStmt.title: The lamentable fall of Queen Elenor, who for her pride and wickedness by Gods judgements sunk into the ground at Charing-Cross and rose at Queen hive. To the tune of, Gentle and courteous.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and W. Gilbertson.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
